column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Today I decided to finally try JINYA for lunch and I was not disappointed! I ordered the JINYA Tonkotsu Black ramen that had an excellent broth and depth of flavor. The meat was tender and juicy
column2: and complemented the broth very well
column3: as did the other toppings. I thought it was a bit odd that the egg was not cut in half
column4: as I normally see in other ramen places
column5: but it was delicious and perfectly cooked. I also loved the texture of the noodles - they definitely weren't soggy but weren't too crunchy - it was the perfect in-between state.
